value: — largest port on Sava, struggling to keep its multi-ethnic community

, lying along the Sava River. Larger
region extends well beyond Bosnia's borders, occupying parts of

lying in the basin of Sava.

Bosanska Posavina was badly hit by the Yugoslav Wars of 1992–1995 in the extreme: The region became virtually deserted, as the locals fled to the adjacent regions and most of their homes were destroyed. Only a small fraction of former inhabitants returned since.

The region traditionally had a Croat majority, while today it is predominantly inhabited by the Serbs.
As most of inhabitants of the region are of Serbian descent today,
is the main language in the region. Although
are mutually intelligible with Serbian as most of the differences between three languages are academic, be ready to decipher some Cyrillic as it is the script of choice amongst Bosnia's Serbs.
